assignment.question: Who will own the different parts of your work product.
assignment.help: [Speak to a lawyer to draft and review language for this section.] This is a free text section for you to describe who will own the deliverable you create, any intellectual property you own that was used to carry out the Engagement, and any Work Product created to support the activities that were not included in the deliverables. It should also include at what point any assignment of ownership occurs. i.e After payment, upon signing, etc. Finally, it should include any limitations on these assignments. i.e. You can't give ownership of third-party tools that you used. [Speak to a lawyer to draft and review language for this section.]

survival.question: Which sections of this agreement will remain in effect after the termination or expiration of this agreement?
survival.help: [Speak to a lawyer to draft and review language for this section.] This is a free text section for you to describe which sections of this agreement will remain in effect after the termination or expiration of the agreement. An example section might look something like this. The provisions of the Sections "Disputes", "Attorney Fees", "Ownership of Work Product", and "Limited Liability" within this Agreement and the Sections "Confidential Information" and "Information Security Safeguards" within the Rules of Engagement will survive any termination of this Agreement.

representations_and_warranties.question: Are there any additional commitments, warranties, and/or representations by either party that needs to be made explicit in the agreement?.
representations_and_warranties.help:
You need to set these in the representations_and_warranties.csv file. 
[Speak to a lawyer to draft and review language for this section.] A representation is a statement of fact that applies to the past or present that if untrue might lead to the contract being voided. (i.e. "Service Provider is independent, non‐product affiliated, and not in the business of selling security systems hardware." or "The recipiant authorized to give authorization to the Service Provider to perform technical assessment activities on all systems, networks, and devices?") Warranties are statements or promise(s) that a condition is, and/or will be, true when made and/or for a period of time, often for the term of the agreement.

limitations_on_liability.question: This is a free text section for you to describe your Liability to the Recipient and the Recipients liability to you.
limitations_on_liability.help: [Speak to a lawyer to draft and review language for this section.]

indemnities.question: This is a free text section for you to describe how parties "indemnify each other from 3rd party action related to the assessment.
indemnities.help: [Speak to a lawyer to draft and review language for this section.] An example of an assessment related indemnity would be a clause stating that the Service Provider is indemnified from any third party legal action  that was caused by actions you took based off of inaccurate information provided by the Recipient. (i.e. if you scan an IP address the Recipient told you they own, but that turns out to be owned by a third party.) You would want them to indemnify you for that action so they take on the liability with the third party actor who sues you. Another example might be that the Recipient wants to be indemnified from future data-breach lawsuits from their clients if they suffer a breach on a system you found no flaws in.
